sect1.title: Introduction

textobject.phrase: Shows Workspace Switcher applet. Contains a button for each workspace.

sect1.para: The &applet; applet displays the workspaces that are on your GNOME desktop. A workspace is a discrete area on the desktop in which you can work. Every workspace on the desktop contains the same desktop background, the same panels, and the same menus. However, you can run different applications and open different windows in each workspace. You can display only one workspace at a time but you can have windows open in other workspaces.

By default, the &applet; applet displays a visual representation of the workspaces on the desktop, as shown in . The applet displays the application windows and dialogs that are open in a workspace. The applet highlights the background of the current workspace and the window that has focus. You can change the default behavior of the applet to display only the names of the workspaces in the applet. See for more information about how to configure the applet.

shows the &applet; applet when the GNOME session contains four workspaces. The applet displays the workspaces in order from left to right across the rows of the applet. In the applet is set up to display the workspaces in one row. See for information about how to change the number of applet rows.

To add &applet; to a panel, right-click on the panel, then choose
Add to Panel Utility Workspace Switcher .

sect2.title: To Navigate Workspaces
sect2.para: The background of the button in the applet that represents the current workspace is highlighted. To switch to another workspace, click on the button that represents the new workspace. If you click on a specific window on a workspace button, &applet; switches to the new workspace and gives focus to the window. To return to your original workspace, click on the button that represents the workspace in the &applet;.
When you switch to a different workspace, the content of the Window List applet changes to reflect the windows that are open in the new workspace.

sect2.title: To Move a Window From One Workspace to Another
sect2.para: To use &applet; to move a window from one workspace to another, drag the window from the current workspace to the new workspace.

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para: To configure the &applet; applet, right-click on the applet, then choose Preferences.

term.guilabel: Show workspace names in the switcher

listitem.para: Select this option to display the names of the workspaces in the applet instead of a visual representation of the workspaces.
Select one of the following options to determine which workspaces the &applet; displays:
Select this option to only display the current workspace in the &applet; applet.

Select this option to show all of the workspaces that are on your GNOME desktop in the &applet; applet. Use the Rows spin box to specify the number of rows to use to display the workspaces in the applet.
Use the list box to edit the names of the workspaces on your desktop. To edit a workspace name, select the name, then type the new name.
Use this spin box to increase or decrease the number of workspaces in the GNOME session.
